item.title: Pinned: I'm fundraising for Crisis. You want to see me take a week of ice-colds showers, right? item.title: RT by @kittylyst: Somebody in Germany said politicians should step up and fix OSS. Dear politicians, OSS works fine, please fix climate first. #log4j #opensource

item.title:
RT by @kittylyst: The Penlee lifeboat disaster saw 16 people lose their lives on 19 December 1981.
Almost forty years on, the son of one of the RNLI crewmen and Penlee lifeboat’s current coxswain, look back on the night disaster struck the small community.
More here: https://bbc.in/3sctD5W
item.dc:creator: @BBCSpotlight

description.p:
The Penlee lifeboat disaster saw 16 people lose their lives on 19 December 1981.
Almost forty years on, the son of one of the RNLI crewmen and Penlee lifeboat’s current coxswain, look back on the night disaster struck the small community.
More here: bbc.in/3sctD5W

item.title: RT by @kittylyst: The current log4j adoption trends seem to imply a tail of two cities. On one camp, remediation happened very quickly, not once, but twice. One the other side, no progress. See more: https://www.sonatype.com/resources/log4j-vulnerability-resource-center
item.dc:creator: @Brian_Fox

description.p: The current log4j adoption trends seem to imply a tail of two cities. On one camp, remediation happened very quickly, not once, but twice. One the other side, no progress. See more: sonatype.com/resources/log4j…

item.dc:creator: @billybragg

item.title:
RT by @kittylyst: your reminder once more that the Conservative government ended homelessness at a stroke in early 2020 because of the pandemic.
then it just threw them all out onto the street again.
homelessness existing was *always* a choice of those in power.
item.dc:creator: @davidgerard

description.p:
your reminder once more that the Conservative government ended homelessness at a stroke in early 2020 because of the pandemic.
then it just threw them all out onto the street again.

item.title: RT by @kittylyst: This is Cassie. Cassie hates almost everyone. But Cassie thinks Amanda is great. Please help Amanda get kidney surgery so Cassie can keep getting Amanda pets - even if it's only a couple of dollars or an RT, it really helps.

description.p:

item.title: RT by @kittylyst: There have been several good critiques of Web3 published recently by @tante, @ncweaver, Robin Sloan, and @alexstamos. I'm sure there are others. Industry partisans can no longer claim that their critics don't get it. The opposition is here and deserves to be heard.
item.dc:creator: @SilvermanJacob

description.p: There have been several good critiques of Web3 published recently by @tante, @ncweaver, Robin Sloan, and @alexstamos. I'm sure there are others. Industry partisans can no longer claim that their critics don't get it. The opposition is here and deserves to be heard.

item.dc:creator: @DouglasBShaw

description.p: Occasional reminder that the adversary decides whether or not deterrence works.

item.title: RT by @kittylyst: Sadly I'm going to have to completely shut down my entire @DeviantArt gallery as people keep stealing my art and making NFTs. I can't - and shouldn't have to - report each one and make a case, which is consistently ignored. Sad and frustrating.
item.dc:creator: @LiamRSharp

description.p: Sadly I'm going to have to completely shut down my entire @DeviantArt gallery as people keep stealing my art and making NFTs. I can't - and shouldn't have to - report each one and make a case, which is consistently ignored. Sad and frustrating.

item.title: RT by @kittylyst: Following a(n old) comment by @JDHamkins on MathOverflow (‌https://mathoverflow.net/a/42998/17064‌), I realized something about the “dangerous bend” sign that's used by Donald Knuth to draw attention to difficult parts in a textbook. 🧵⤵️ •1/6
item.dc:creator: @gro_tsen

description.p: Following a(n old) comment by @JDHamkins on MathOverflow (‌mathoverflow.net/a/42998/170…‌), I realized something about the “dangerous bend” sign that's used by Donald Knuth to draw attention to difficult parts in a textbook. 🧵⤵️ •1/6
